    create-changed-data

    create-changed-data.Rmd

    Motivation

    The goal of the dfdiffs is to answer the following questions:

    1. What rows are here now that weren’t here before?
    2. What rows were here before that aren’t here now?
    3. What values have been changed?

    This vignette takes us through the create_changed_data() function, which answers the “What values have been changed?”. We also have another function that detects modified data, create_modified_data().

    Packages 

    library(dplyr)
library(stringr)
library(forcats)
library(lubridate)
library(fs)
library(vctrs)
library(glue)
library(purrr)
library(vroom)
library(haven)
library(readxl)
library(dfdiffs)

    Changed data

    We have two datasets to test what’s been modified:

    Initial Data 

    InitialData <- dfdiffs::InitialData
    subject_id record text_value_a text_value_b created_date updated_date entered_date
    A 1 Issue unresolved Fatigue 2021-07-29 2021-09-29 2021-09-29
    A 2 Issue unresolved Fatigue 2021-07-29 2021-10-03 2021-10-29
    B 3 Issue resolved Fever 2021-07-16 2021-09-02 2021-08-18
    C 4 Issue resolved Joint pain 2021-08-24 2021-10-03 2021-10-03
    C 5 Issue resolved Joint pain 2021-08-24 2021-09-20 2021-10-20

    Changed Data 

    ChangedData <- dfdiffs::ChangedData
    subject_id record text_value_a text_value_b created_date updated_date entered_date
    A 1 Issue resolved Fatigue 2021-07-29 2021-10-03 2021-11-30
    A 2 Issue resolved Fatigue 2021-07-29 2021-11-27 2021-11-30
    B 3 Issue resolved Fever 2021-07-16 2021-10-20 2021-11-21
    C 4 Issue resolved Joint pain, stiffness and swelling 2021-08-24 2021-10-13 2021-11-11
    C 5 Issue resolved Joint pain 2021-08-24 2021-10-14 2021-11-16

    These data do not have a unique identifier, but we can create one with the create_join_column() function.

    Lahman datasets

    We will also import two master datasets from the Lahman baseball package because they’re larger and have unique keys.

    nycflights13 data

    We’ll also test this with some data from the nycflights13.

    library(nycflights13)

    We’ll create two small datasets, jfk_flights and jfk_weather that we will alter and use for testing.

    jfk_flights <- dfdiffs::jfk_flights

    Conditions

    Each function in the dfdiffs package assumes the following conditions:

    Single by column conditions

    1. Two datasets, compare all columns:

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData, 
  base = InitialData)

    2. Multiple columns to compare (cols):

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData, 
  base = InitialData, 
  cols = c("text_value_a", "text_value_b"))

    3. Single by column, no new column name

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedDataJoin, 
  base = InitialDataJoin, 
  by = "join_var")

    4. Single by column, new column name (by_col)

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedDataJoin, 
  base = InitialDataJoin, 
  by = "join_var",
  by_col = "new_join_var")

    5. Single by column, multiple compare columns cols

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedDataJoin, 
  base = InitialDataJoin, 
  by = "join_var", 
  cols = c("text_value_a", "text_value_b"))

    6. Single by column, new column name (by_col), multiple compare columns (cols)

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedDataJoin, 
  base = InitialDataJoin, 
  by = "join_var", 
  by_col = "new_join_var",
  cols = c("text_value_a", "text_value_b"))

    Multiple by column conditions

    1. Multiple by columns

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData, 
  base = InitialData, 
  by = c("subject_id", "record"))

    2. Multiple by columns, new column name (by_col)

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData, 
  base = InitialData, 
  by = c("subject_id", "record"), 
  by_col = "new_join_var")

    3. Multiple by columns, multiple compare columns (cols)

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData, 
  base = InitialData, 
  by = c("subject_id", "record"), 
  cols = c("text_value_a", "text_value_b"))

    4. Multiple by columns, a new by_col, and cols

      create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData, 
  base = InitialData, 
  by = c("subject_id", "record"), 
  cols = c("text_value_a", "text_value_b"))

    Creating a join column

    The new column will be named "join_var", and it will be formed from "subject_id" and "record".

    ChangedDataJoin <- dfdiffs::create_new_column(
  data = ChangedData, 
  cols = c("subject_id", "record"), 
  new_name = "join_var")
knitr::kable(ChangedDataJoin)
    join_var subject_id record text_value_a text_value_b created_date updated_date entered_date
    A-1 A 1 Issue resolved Fatigue 2021-07-29 2021-10-03 2021-11-30
    A-2 A 2 Issue resolved Fatigue 2021-07-29 2021-11-27 2021-11-30
    B-3 B 3 Issue resolved Fever 2021-07-16 2021-10-20 2021-11-21
    C-4 C 4 Issue resolved Joint pain, stiffness and swelling 2021-08-24 2021-10-13 2021-11-11
    C-5 C 5 Issue resolved Joint pain 2021-08-24 2021-10-14 2021-11-16 
    InitialDataJoin <- dfdiffs::create_new_column(
  data = InitialData, 
  cols = c("subject_id", "record"), 
  new_name = "join_var")
knitr::kable(InitialDataJoin)
    join_var subject_id record text_value_a text_value_b created_date updated_date entered_date
    A-1 A 1 Issue unresolved Fatigue 2021-07-29 2021-09-29 2021-09-29
    A-2 A 2 Issue unresolved Fatigue 2021-07-29 2021-10-03 2021-10-29
    B-3 B 3 Issue resolved Fever 2021-07-16 2021-09-02 2021-08-18
    C-4 C 4 Issue resolved Joint pain 2021-08-24 2021-10-03 2021-10-03
    C-5 C 5 Issue resolved Joint pain 2021-08-24 2021-09-20 2021-10-20

    create_changed_data()

    The create_changed_data() function arguments are below:

    create_changed_data(compare = , base = , by = , by_col = , cols = )

    Single by column conditions

    Below are the circumstances where we provide no by column (row-by-row comparison) or a single by column.

    1) Two datasets, compare all columns:

    In this case, two datasets are provided without a by joining column.

    changed_cond_1 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData, 
  base = InitialData)
glimpse(changed_cond_1)
#> List of 2
#> $ num_diffs: issue [4 × 2] (S3: issue/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
#> ..$ variable : chr [1:4] "text_value_a" "text_value_b" "updated_date"
#>    "entered_date"
#> ..$ no_of_differences: Named int [1:4] 2 1 5 5
#> .. ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:4] "text_value_a" "text_value_b"
#>    "updated_date" "entered_date"
#> ..- attr(*, "message")= chr "Not all Values Compared Equal"
#> $ var_diffs: issue [13 × 4] (S3: issue/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
#> ..$ variable : chr [1:13] "text_value_a" "text_value_a" "text_value_b"
#>    "updated_date" ...
#> ..$ rownumber: chr [1:13] "1" "2" "4" "1" ...
#> ..$ base : chr [1:13] "Issue unresolved" "Issue unresolved" "Joint pain"
#>    "2021-09-29" ...
#> ..$ compare : chr [1:13] "Issue resolved" "Issue resolved" "Joint pain,
#>    stiffness and swelling" "2021-10-03" ...
#> ..- attr(*, "message")= chr ""
    variable no_of_differences
    text_value_a 2
    text_value_b 1
    updated_date 5
    entered_date 5
    variable rownumber base compare
    text_value_a 1 Issue unresolved Issue resolved
    text_value_a 2 Issue unresolved Issue resolved
    text_value_b 4 Joint pain Joint pain, stiffness and swelling
    updated_date 1 2021-09-29 2021-10-03
    updated_date 2 2021-10-03 2021-11-27
    updated_date 3 2021-09-02 2021-10-20
    updated_date 4 2021-10-03 2021-10-13
    updated_date 5 2021-09-20 2021-10-14
    entered_date 1 2021-09-29 2021-11-30
    entered_date 2 2021-10-29 2021-11-30
    entered_date 3 2021-08-18 2021-11-21
    entered_date 4 2021-10-03 2021-11-11
    entered_date 5 2021-10-20 2021-11-16

    2) Multiple columns to compare (cols):

    Here we have no by column, but specified columns to compare (with cols)

    changed_cond_2 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData,
  base = InitialData,
  cols = c("text_value_a", "text_value_b"))
glimpse(changed_cond_2)
#> List of 2
#> $ num_diffs: issue [2 × 2] (S3: issue/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
#> ..$ variable : chr [1:2] "text_value_a" "text_value_b"
#> ..$ no_of_differences: Named int [1:2] 2 1
#> .. ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:2] "text_value_a" "text_value_b"
#> ..- attr(*, "message")= chr "Not all Values Compared Equal"
#> $ var_diffs: issue [3 × 4] (S3: issue/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
#> ..$ variable : chr [1:3] "text_value_a" "text_value_a" "text_value_b"
#> ..$ rownumber: chr [1:3] "1" "2" "4"
#> ..$ base : chr [1:3] "Issue unresolved" "Issue unresolved" "Joint pain"
#> ..$ compare : chr [1:3] "Issue resolved" "Issue resolved" "Joint pain,
#>    stiffness and swelling"
#> ..- attr(*, "message")= chr ""
    variable no_of_differences
    text_value_a 2
    text_value_b 1
    variable rownumber base compare
    text_value_a 1 Issue unresolved Issue resolved
    text_value_a 2 Issue unresolved Issue resolved
    text_value_b 4 Joint pain Joint pain, stiffness and swelling

    3) Single by column, no new column name

    This is the most common condition: Two datasets with a single joining by column. No cols or by_col. We’ll run this on two datasets:

    1. InitialDataJoin vs. ChangedDataJoin
    2. master15 vs. master20 
    changed_cond_3 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedDataJoin,
  base = InitialDataJoin,
  by = "join_var")
glimpse(changed_cond_3)
#> List of 2
#> $ num_diffs: issue [4 × 2] (S3: issue/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
#> ..$ variable : chr [1:4] "text_value_a" "text_value_b" "updated_date"
#>    "entered_date"
#> ..$ no_of_differences: Named int [1:4] 2 1 5 5
#> .. ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:4] "text_value_a" "text_value_b"
#>    "updated_date" "entered_date"
#> ..- attr(*, "message")= chr "Not all Values Compared Equal"
#> $ var_diffs: issue [13 × 4] (S3: issue/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
#> ..$ variable: chr [1:13] "text_value_a" "text_value_a" "text_value_b"
#>    "updated_date" ...
#> ..$ join_var: chr [1:13] "A-1" "A-2" "C-4" "A-1" ...
#> ..$ base : chr [1:13] "Issue unresolved" "Issue unresolved" "Joint pain"
#>    "2021-09-29" ...
#> ..$ compare : chr [1:13] "Issue resolved" "Issue resolved" "Joint pain,
#>    stiffness and swelling" "2021-10-03" ...

    entered_date 5

    text_value_a A-2 Issue unresolved Issue resolved
    text_value_b C-4 Joint pain Joint pain, stiffness and swelling
    updated_date A-1 2021-09-29 2021-10-03
    updated_date A-2 2021-10-03 2021-11-27
    updated_date B-3 2021-09-02 2021-10-20
    updated_date C-4 2021-10-03 2021-10-13
    updated_date C-5 2021-09-20 2021-10-14
    entered_date A-1 2021-09-29 2021-11-30
    entered_date A-2 2021-10-29 2021-11-30
    entered_date B-3 2021-08-18 2021-11-21
    entered_date C-4 2021-10-03 2021-11-11
    entered_date C-5 2021-10-20 2021-11-16

    For the master15 vs. master20, we’ll only display the head() output from the base_diffs, comp_diffs, num_diffs and var_diffs

    changed_cond_3 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = master20,
  base = master15,
  by = "playerID")
str(changed_cond_3)

    4) Single by column, new column name (by_col)

    Here we have a single joining by column, but we’re going to provide a new name with by_col. User supplies a by/keys column, and a new column name. This is accomplished with the rename_join_col() (see example below).

    # rename join column 
new_join_col <- "join_col"
rename_join_col(data = master15, 
  by = "playerID", 
  by_col = new_join_col) |> 
  select(contains(new_join_col)) |> 
  head()
#> # A tibble: 6 × 1
#>   join_col 
#>   <chr>    
#> 1 aardsda01
#> 2 aaronha01
#> 3 aaronto01
#> 4 aasedo01 
#> 5 abadan01 
#> 6 abadfe01

    We will run this condition using InitialDataJoin vs. ChangedDataJoin

    changed_cond_4 <- create_changed_data(
      compare = ChangedDataJoin,
      base = InitialDataJoin,
      by = "join_var",
      by_col = "new_join_var")
glimpse(changed_cond_4)
#> List of 2
#> $ num_diffs: issue [4 × 2] (S3: issue/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
#> ..$ variable : chr [1:4] "text_value_a" "text_value_b" "updated_date"
#>    "entered_date"
#> ..$ no_of_differences: Named int [1:4] 2 1 5 5
#> .. ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:4] "text_value_a" "text_value_b"
#>    "updated_date" "entered_date"
#> ..- attr(*, "message")= chr "Not all Values Compared Equal"
#> $ var_diffs: issue [13 × 4] (S3: issue/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
#> ..$ variable : chr [1:13] "text_value_a" "text_value_a" "text_value_b"
#>    "updated_date" ...
#> ..$ new_join_var: chr [1:13] "A-1" "A-2" "C-4" "A-1" ...
#> ..$ base : chr [1:13] "Issue unresolved" "Issue unresolved" "Joint pain"
#>    "2021-09-29" ...
#> ..$ compare : chr [1:13] "Issue resolved" "Issue resolved" "Joint pain,
#>    stiffness and swelling" "2021-10-03" ...
#> ..- attr(*, "message")= chr ""
    variable no_of_differences
    text_value_a 2
    text_value_b 1
    updated_date 5
    entered_date 5
    variable new_join_var base compare
    text_value_a A-1 Issue unresolved Issue resolved
    text_value_a A-2 Issue unresolved Issue resolved
    text_value_b C-4 Joint pain Joint pain, stiffness and swelling
    updated_date A-1 2021-09-29 2021-10-03
    updated_date A-2 2021-10-03 2021-11-27
    updated_date B-3 2021-09-02 2021-10-20

    And run this condition using master15 vs. master20 (but only show the head() of the output tables).

    changed_cond_4 <- create_changed_data(

      by_col = "new_join_var")

    5) Single by column, multiple compare columns cols

    User provides a by/keys column, and only wants to view the comparison of a select number of columns from each dataset.

    changed_cond_5 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedDataJoin,
  base = InitialDataJoin,
  by = "join_var",
  cols = c("text_value_a", "text_value_b"))
glimpse(changed_cond_5)

    6) Single by column, new column name (by_col), multiple compare columns (cols)

    User supplies a by/keys variable, a new column name for the join column (by_col), and a select number of columns to compare and view.

    First we test on InitialDataJoin vs ChangedDataJoin:

    changed_cond_6 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedDataJoin,
  base = InitialDataJoin,
  by = "join_var",
  by_col = "new_join_var",
  cols = c("text_value_a", "text_value_b"))
glimpse(changed_cond_6)

    We also want to test the condition in which the by column is included with the compare columns (cols ).

    changed_cond_6.1 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = master15,
  base = master20,
  by = "playerID",
  by_col = "new_join_var",
  cols = c("playerID", "nameFirst", "nameLast", "nameGiven"))
#> Error in create_changed_data(compare = master15, base = master20, by = "playerID", : The 'by' column is listed in the columns to compare ('cols)

    Here we get an error–the by column is included in the cols argument. This will be included in the application as a warning.

    Multiple by column conditions

    These conditions are slightly different than the previous six because we’re going to be building the join column using the create_join_column() function we covered above.

    7) Multiple by columns

    User provides multiple by columns, but no by_col, so the new join column is named a generic "join".

    We’ll start by testing this with the smaller datasets, InitialData and ChangedData, and create a new join column using subject_id and record.

    changed_cond_7 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData,
  base = InitialData,
  by = c("subject_id", "record"))
glimpse(changed_cond_7)

    9) Multiple by columns, multiple compare columns (cols)

    User provides by/keys and columns to compare, but no new by_col. We will test this with InitialData vs. ChangedData.

    changed_cond_9 <- create_changed_data(

    text_value_b C-4 Joint pain Joint pain, stiffness and swelling

    And we will test this with the larger master15 vs. master20 datasets, using "playerID" and "nameGiven" as the by/keys and the "nameFirst" and "nameLast" as the cols.

    changed_cond_9 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = master20,
  base = master15,
  by = c("playerID", "nameGiven"),
  cols = c("nameFirst", "nameLast"))
glimpse(changed_cond_9)

    nameFirst carrodo01-Ralph Arthur Doc Ralph

    10) Multiple by columns, a new by_col, and cols

    User provides multiple by columns, a new name for the by_col, and a select number of columns to compare col.

    We will start by testing this condition on the InitialData vs. the ChangedData, using "subject_id" and "record" as the by/keys, "new_join_var" as the new by_col, and "text_value_a", "text_value_b" as the cols.

    changed_cond_10 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = ChangedData,
  base = InitialData,
  by = c("subject_id", "record"),
  by_col = "new_join_var",
  cols = c("text_value_a", "text_value_b"))
    variable no_of_differences
    text_value_a 2
    text_value_b 1
    variable new_join_var base compare
    text_value_a A-1 Issue unresolved Issue resolved
    text_value_a A-2 Issue unresolved Issue resolved
    text_value_b C-4 Joint pain Joint pain, stiffness and swelling

    Now we will test this condition on the master15 vs. the master20, using "playerID" and "nameGiven" as the by/keys, "new_join_var" as the new by_col, and "nameFirst", "nameLast" as the cols.

    changed_cond_10 <- create_changed_data(
  compare = master20,
  base = master15,
  by = c("playerID", "nameGiven"),
  cols = c("nameFirst", "nameLast"))
glimpse(changed_cond_10)
